Description: Body sherd of Chian Wild Goat Style pottery chalice; white slip; interior: glazed streaky black with added red band on cul; exterior: painted decoration consisting of lower part of goose walking, to right; below, in handle zone, two dilute lines above maeander band running left.
Producer name: Drawn by: Group of the Würzburg Chalices
Curator's comments: Lemos places this sherd in the Würzburg Chalice Group. The sherds from this group display stylistic similarities to the two Würzburg chalices (Lemos 1991, pl. 20-1, no. 236-7).
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 71, p. 235, no. 148, pl. 14)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0154) (phase 2)
